info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 6 at 4:15PM EDT until September 6 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield, Middlesex and New Haven.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of near 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Norwalk, Milford, Shelton, Guilford, New Canaan, Clinton, Chester, Fairfield, Hamden, Stratford, Trumbull, Branford, Westport, North Haven, Darien, Wilton and North Branford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Fairfield, CT; Middlesex, CT; New Haven, CT
